attributes.comment:
I am outraged at the proposed USCIS fee changes!!!!!!!!! Three of my children are
international adoptees. They entered this country with IR-3 Visas and, under U.S.
law, became U.S. citizens upon entrance into the U.S. BUT because USCIS only
sent them green cards because they did not have a process in place at that time
to automatically issue adoptees their certificates of citizenship, we have to submit
an application for citizenship just as though they were not citizens at all. The
process has been changed since we brought our children home but USCIS has
not found a way to issue my children their certificates of citizenship without us
filing the same application as non-citizen applicants and also paying the same fee
as non-citizen applicants. That alone is unfair and outrageous. So while this
required process is outrageous since my children are already U.S. citizens, it is
even more outrageous that now USCIS intends to substantially increase the
application fees. Instead of costing my family $765 to obtain the 3 certificates of
citizenship under the proposed fee increases it will cost my family $1,388. Do you
really think this is fair? I certainly don't nor do all the adoptive families who are in
the same situation we are in.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Martha Reading
